alert.note: Alert for Chowan; Gates; Perquimans (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 30 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, in northeast North Carolina, Chowan, Gates and Perquimans. In southeast Virginia, City of Franklin, City of Suffolk, Isle of Wight and Southampton. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Smithfield, Windsor, Gatesville, Holland, Downtown Suffolk, Sunbury, Ryland, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Gates, Whaleyville, Corapeake, Kings Fork, Carrsville, Roduco, Driver, Zuni and Hunterdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
